wotds.definition: A compendium of mystical knowledge supposedly encoded in a non-physical plane of existence known as the astral plane.
Refers to the notion of "not-self" or the illusion of "self".
Repeats words or phrases in reverse order. "He who questions training only trains himself at asking questions." (The Sphinx, Mystery Men)
The glorification of a subject to divine level. The treatment of any subject in a particularly grand or exalted manner
An omen or prediction; a foreboding.
Any facility for which the government will deny existence; such as a location at which an unacknowledged black project is conducted.
A figure of speech that is an abbreviated expression, for example, the omission of "good" from "good morning!" (resulting in the abbreviated greeting "morning!").

One of two positions taken by theorists in which events are ordered via a tensed A-series or a tenseless B-series. The B-theory supports that time is static: despite appearances, time has no "flow" or "passage". The A Theory supports the passage of time is a very real and inexorable feature of the world, and not merely some mind-dependent phenomenon.

Used to define cultures who interpret technologically advanced visitors as religious or supernatural figures who bring boons of cargo and will perform ritualistic acts to obtain said cargo. Cargo cults often develop during a combination of crises.
Meeting points of nadiis (channels through which the life force/vital energy moves) in the subtle human body.
A series of widespread, unofficial ceasefires that took place along the Western Front around Christmas 1914, during World War I.

A part of the unconscious mind incorporating patterns of memories, psychic material, instincts, and experiences common to all mankind. These patterns are inherited, may be arranged into archetypes, and are observable through their effects on dreams, behaviour, etc.
Distorted intelligence passed on to a double agent containing some truth.
A spy posing as an informant who supplies deliberately misleading information.
A universal intelligence or subordinate that converts abstract metaphysical ideas into physically manifest forms. Originally used to mean craftsman/artisian.

Although often ascribed to Greek mythology, its orgins are uncertain and may refer to a pagan deity or demon associated with the underworld or a mysterious spirit/deity often explained as a primeval creator god.

Small membranous protrusion from a neuron's dendrite that typically receives input from a single synapse of an axon. Dendritic spines serve as a storage site for synaptic strength and help transmit electrical signals.
The birthday of an individual, or the anniversary of a founding event.

Every dynasty/empire goes through a culture cycle. It begins with a Dynasty/Ruler gaining the Mandate of Heaven. The Mandate is lost due to decline. War/clashes occur. One state/empire emerges in victory. The new dynasty/ruler gains the Mandate.

Created in the early 60s to monitor military and diplomatic communications during the Cold War. By the end of the 20th century, the system had evolved to describe a SIGINT collection and analysis network.

The vital or creative force in all organisms that is responsible for growth and evolution. It is believed that this essence can be harvested and embedded into an inanimate substance and activated with electricity.
A process, often used to make a point, that takes a simple statement and expands it, breaking it down into parts and emphasizing the detail.
Repeats something from the beginning of a sentence at the end of the sentence - The king is dead; long live the king.
A pithy, witty poem or saying expressing a single thought or observation. Often contains a paradoxical statement or  ending with an ingenious turn of thought.
A concept that the universe has been recurring, and will continue to recur, in a self-similar form an infinite number of times across infinite time or space.
A callback function that handles inputs received in a program.
All the shared body of knowledge which is not explicitly used when people communicate, but without which communication would be impossible. Shared context.
A strategy where pitched battles are avoided in favor of wearing down an opponent through a war of attrition and indirection.
An unusual and complex form of superior mirage. This phenomena could be associated with occurrences of the the mysterious Australian Min Min light and the Crocker Land Expedition.
A sacrifice (usually of a pawn) in the opening moves used to gain an early advantage in space and/or time.
Height Above Average Terrain. Measures the height a transmitting point is above the surrounding topography; used for broadcasting activities (data, voice, radio, etc.).

A Department of Defense group formed in the 1970s to create a programming language suitable for the DoD needs using the Steelman Language requirements. The programming language created was called Ada.
An exaggeration used to create emphasis or effect.
A condition in which an individual possesses a superior autobiographical memory, meaning he or she can recall the vast majority of personal experiences and events in his or her life.
Refers to the difficulty a person can have understanding an issue and making decisions that can be caused by the presence of too much information (A.K.A.infoxication).

In order for a virus or other concept to be considered in the wild, "it must be spreading as a result of normal day-to-day operations between... ...unsuspecting users," (Paul Ducklin). Opposite of in-situ activity.
Of or relating to the very essence of a thing; belonging naturally, not merely apparent or accidental. Many take intrinsic value to be crucial to a variety of ethics and moral judgments.
A general framework that is used to convert observed measurements into information about a physical object or system; often provides information about a parameter that we cannot directly observe.
From chess, the international signal that a player intends to adjust the position of a piece on the board without being subject to the touched piece rule.
The Egyptian concept of vital essence; that which distinguishes the difference between a living and a dead person with death occurring when the ka left the body.

A method of measuring a civilization's level of technological advancement, based on the amount of energy a civilization is able to utilize. The scale has three designated categories called Type I, II, and III.

The Ancient Egyptians considered the khat plant a divine food, capable of releasing humanity's divinity; they used it for transcending into "apotheosis", with the intent of making the user god-like. Also used in descriptions of the soul/body.
When objects have been broken, this is a technique of repairing them with gold or silver often making them more beautiful after they've been repaired than they were when they were new.
In cryptanalysis, a term used at Bletchley Park for occasions when the enemy sent an identical message twice, once in a breakable cipher and again in an unbroken cipher.
A disorder that sporadically hinders a person's ability to clearly articulate their thoughts as they temporarily forget names, words and phrases in conversations.

A unit of cultural information, such as a cultural practice or idea, that is transmitted verbally or by repeated action from one mind to another and may evolve by natural selection in a manner analogous to that of biological evolution. Memes spread through the behavior that they generate in their hosts.

A communications network made up of radio nodes organized in a mesh topology designed to be deployed over wide geographical areas. It may be impossible to go off grid in cities that develop wireless mesh networks.
In psychology, denotes a process of reforming the psyche as a form of self healing, a proposed explanation for the phenomenon of psychotic breakdown; often viewed as a productive process.
Referring to transmigration of the soul, especially its reincarnation after death.
The Japanese and Korean term mu (Chinese wu) meaning not have; without. The term is often used or translated to mean that the question itself must be "unasked".

A hypothetical stage of human thought (prior to scientific thought) that explains the tendency to create myths. This relates to seeing most things as persons as opposed to seeing most things as impersonal objects.

The entropy that a living system exports to keep its own entropy low; it lies at the intersection of entropy and life. In information theory and statistics, negentropy is used as a measure of distance to normality
A hypothetical vital energy or life force associated with biological electromagnetic fields. It may be visible as colored auras surrounding living things, crystals, and magnets.
A maximum level of complexity and consciousness towards which the universe is evolving.
One who temporarily disappears from "the Infosphere". Not visible to cameras or detectable through electronic mid.
A form of hallucination that involves perceiving sounds without auditory stimulus; musical ear syndrome is an example.
A state of allocation of resources in which it is impossible to make any one individual better off without making at least one individual worse off..
A form of deception in which one side promises to act in good faith (e.g., by raising a flag of surrender) with the intention of breaking that promise once the enemy has exposed themselves.
An attitude of mind that abruptly dismisses a subject because it causes discomfort and/or does not fit in with the person's current interests, the importance of the subject notwithstanding.
An active principle forming part of any living thing, frequently translated as "natural energy", "life force", or "energy flow". The literal translation of "qi" is "breath", "air", or "gas".
The use of quantum mechanical effects (in particular quantum communication and quantum computation) to perform cryptographic tasks or to break cryptographic systems. QKD is an example.

An agent who gets caught as a double agent and is forced to mislead the foreign intelligence service. Different from a triple agent pretends to be a double agent for one side, while he or she is truly a double agent for the other side.

Gaelic festival marking the end of the harvest season and the beginning of winter or the "darker half" of the year. It is celebrated from sunset on 31 October to sunset on 1 November, which is nearly halfway between the autumn equinox and the winter solstice.
Sharing phones, cars, credit cards with another person in such a way as to appear to be in several places at once to a security agency.  From the film "Sybil".

Likeness or similarity. Sometimes used to describe a representation, such as a statue or a painting, especially of a god. Also has a secondary association of inferiority: an image without the substance or qualities of the original.
Secret, shady, doubtful.

Events and stages of society and history generally repeat themselves in cycles. One example of a social cycle is the Law of Social Cycles (while people in any society are all relatively similar, we differ in the way we go about achieving our goals and fall into four general categories).

A self-reinforcing solitary wave (a wave packet or pulse) that maintains its shape while it travels at constant speed. Solitons are caused by a cancellation of nonlinear and dispersive effects in the medium. May occur in proteins and DNA.

An astronomical event that occurs twice each year as the Sun reaches its highest or lowest excursion relative to the celestial equator on the celestial sphere. Many societies use this point to mark special rituals
The static friction that needs to be overcome to enable relative motion of stationary objects in contact. A very important concept related to the Casimir Effect (Force). It is a portmanteau.
Projecting where a person will be, what they will be doing and with whom at a certain time.
The ability to focus on a small set of key variables to make a quick decision rather than consciously considering every possible variable. Especially applicable to time dependent problem-solving.

Also known as the Heaven and Earth Association or the Triads, (literally means the society, hui, of the heaven, tian, and the earth, di) was one of the earliest, largest, and most enduring of the Chinese secret societies.
Chronological records of an individual's or group's activities designed to store and display large amounts of information in as little space as possible.
An automatic mechanism for activating a device at a preset time.

A piece of headgear made from one or more sheets of aluminium foil or similar material. One may wear the hat in the belief that it shields the brain from electromagnetic fields, to prevent mind control and/or mind reading, or to limit the transmission of voices directly into the brain.
A term used to refer to people who continue to believe in a paranormal event or phenomenon even after it has been proven to have been staged.
Advantageous, useful; e.g. The increase in items dropped from portals may prove to be very utile.

A transient fluctuation that exhibits many of the characteristics of an ordinary particle, but that exists for a limited time. The longer the virtual particle exists, the closer its characteristics come to those of ordinary particles.

A concept of a person whose original soul has departed his or her body and has been replaced with a new soul, either 

temporarily or permanently.

A random signal with a flat (constant) power spectral density often emitted to foil electronic eavesdropping devices. An infinite-bandwidth white noise signal is a purely theoretical construction.  Sometimes used in the metaphoric sense of random talk without meaningful contents.
The lowest possible energy that a quantum mechanical physical system may have. ZPE is fundamentally related to the Heisenberg uncertainty principle.
Taking pleasure in others' misfortune. Schadenfreude.

A v1r4l ph3n0m3n0n of perception caused by exposure to an unstructured, uniform stimulation field. It is the result of the brain amplifying neural noise in order to look for the missing visual (or audio) signals. It may be linked to the condition known as prisoner's cinema as well as other phenomena.

A megastructure of immense computational capacity using a Dyson sphere system for energy.  One potential use would be to run uploads of human minds into virtual reality spaces.  Often seen as an alternative to the Jupiter Brain.

A series of social psychology experiments conducted by Stanley Milgram, which measured the willingness of participants to obey an authority figure who instructed them to perform acts that conflicted with their personal conscience.

An institution created in 1910 to gather together all the world's knowledge and classify it according to a system they developed called the Universal Decimal Classification. Some consider it a forerunner of the Internet.

The intelligible world (composed of forms/ideas) is Parmenidean, the visible world (material world of change) is Heraclitean. Forms in the intelligible realm are postulated to be the objects of knowledge. Precursor to the Theory of Forms.
Dispersing or dispelling shadows. Related to sciagraphy and sciatheric.
The visible manifestation of a deity to a human or other being.
To wipe off, clean away.
Before the dawn.
A symbolic representation of samsara.
To assimilate or absorb ideas; to receive into the mind and retain.
Refers to people's tendency to strongly prefer avoiding losses to acquiring gains; losses are more powerful, in a n0nc0n5c10us sense, than gains.
The holiest of holies, an inviolably private place.
A legal or administrative body or court with strict, arbitrary rulings and secretive proceedings.
The analysis of large quantities of data to extract previously unknown interesting patterns.
A space or gap; an absent part. Example: Lacunar Amnesia - loss of memory about one specific event. Plural lacunae.
A word or phrase that results from a mishearing of something said or sung.

A tenet of Pashtunwali that allows a beleaguered person to enter the house of any other person and make a request of him/her which cannot be refused, even at the cost of the host's own life or fortune.
The real world filtered by our sensory input (sight, hearing, touch, etc).
Self-manifested or that which is created by its own accord.
The faculty of making unhappy, unlucky discoveries. The inexorable discovery of what no one wants to know. The opposite/balance to serendipity.
Refers to a system capable of reproducing and maintaining itself. An autopoietic system is at the same time the producer and the product.
The effect of a picture appearing within itself, in a place where a similar picture would realistically be expected to appear in a recursive pattern; a visual example of a strange loop.
A universe that is both locked inside and encompasses a number of other universes, like a set of Russian wooden dolls, with one or more dolls each nested inside another.
The act of bowing or prostrating oneself before a person of higher social rank.
The focused attention on the symptoms of one's distress (especially bad feelings and experiences from the past) and on its possible causes and consequences, as opposed to its solutions.
A figure of speech where a part of something represents the whole or it may use a whole to represent a part. May also use larger groups to refer to smaller groups or vice versa.
An external or environmental cue that entrains, or synchronizes, an organism's biological rhythms.
Designed to ward off or avert evil.
A case of a recursive definition that is not defined in terms of itself. The base case is what stops a recursion function from continuing on forever.
"The Book of Calculation" written by Leonardo of Pisa. Among the first Western books to describe Hindu-Arabic numbers as well as describing the Fibonacci sequence.

A navigation/location technique based on the measurement of the difference in distance to two stations at known locations that broadcast signals at known times. Can be used as one method to track the location of mobile phones and similar devices.














0b0702010706191d0600060e0a0f0f0c

A physical or chemical agent that changes the genetic material of an organism (mutagensis) and increases the frequency of mutations (changes in the nucleotide sequence of a cell's genome) above the natural background level. Not all mutations are caused by mutagens.
A concept of rebirth or re-creation. Used in biology for the exact reproduction of ancestral features by inheritance.
Certain systems will, after a sufficiently long time, return to a state very close to the initial state.
A neural structuring of the brain, which allows for widely distributed groups of neurons to achieve integrated and synchronized firing, which is proposed to be a requirement for consciousness.
The involuntary repetition or imitation of another person's actions (similar to echolalia, the involuntary repetition of sounds and language).

A type of group mind which is created when people consciously come together for a common purpose. It is sometimes used to indicate the general imprint that encircles a group entity; the summary of the physical, emotional, mental and spiritual energies generated.
A logical operator, or, that results in true whenever one or more of its operands are true.  E.g. "A or B" is true if A is true, or if B is true, or if both A and B are true.
An acoustic hailing device and sonic weapon developed to send messages, warnings, and harmful, pain inducing tones over long distances.
A basic pattern that is found in many myths from around the world. Sometimes called the hero's journey.
The pleasure received from anticipating success.

The quality of apparent purposefulness and of goal-directedness of structures and functions in living organisms that 
derive from their evolutionary adaptation. "Teleonomy is Darwinian teleology.  It doesn't explain design. It explains it away." - mregnor
A concluding section in music that is based, as a general rule, on extensions or reelaborations of thematic material previously heard.
A preoccupation of mind held so firmly as to resist any attempt to modify it.

A figure of speech in which a thing or concept is called not by its own name but rather by the name of something associated in meaning with that thing or concept. Example - Hollywood is used as a metonymy for the U.S. film industry.
The study of the structures of experience and consciousness.
The odds and ends on a spy's person that legitimize their assumed identity such as random knickknacks planted as evidence of their imaginary occupation.

One of a series of systematic studies of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) conducted by the United States Air Force (Project Sign and Project Grudge were the first in the series) whose findings were published in the Condon Report.

The Wheel of Fortune. A concept referring to the capricious nature of Fate. The wheel belongs to the goddess Fortuna, who spins it at random, changing the positions of those on the wheel, some suffer great misfortune, others gain windfalls.
Warning, reminder.
Also known as a collective name, used when creative work is published under one pen name even though more than one author may have contributed to the series.
The idea that the mind produces ideas that are not derived from external sources, and that we have abilities that are innate and not learned.
A sentimentality for the past, typically for a period or place with happy personal associations. Often triggered by something reminding an individual of an event or item from their past.

The doctrine that mind (or soul) is a fundamental feature of the world which exists throughout the universe; the primordial feature from which all others are derived. The panpsychist sees him or herself as a mind in a world of minds.
A unit of quantum information; the quantum analogue of the classical bit. Often used in discussing Bell's Theorem.
A field that explores consciousness in a technological environment and how new technologies affect human consciousness.
The belief that the soul is inherited from the parents along with the body; the immaterial aspect is transmitted through natural generation.
Conveying an innocent meaning to an outsider but a hidden meaning to a member of an underground or secret group.
Experiment designed to test how peer pressure to conform would influence the judgment and individuality of a test subject.
A premise or starting point of reasoning so evident as to be accepted as true without controversy.
To be at a loss, to be uncertain what course to take.
A spirit-image of a living or dead person; a shade or phantom look-alike of the human form.
Describes eight circuits of information (eight "brains") that operate within the human nervous system. Each circuit is concerned with a different sphere of activity.
The tendency to believe that one's ethnic or cultural group is centrally important, and that all other groups are measured in relation to one's own.
A beginner in any field of learning. Also often usd for someone who is learning the alphabet.
A loss of ability to recognize objects, persons, sounds, shapes, or smells while the specific sense is not defective nor is there any significant memory loss.
Vehement disagreement with or dislike of something.
A form of redundancy check used for error detection on identification numbers, which have been input manually.

An exotic atom in which positive and negative pions are bound together.  It has a short lifetime and is currently under investigation at CERN to measure its lifetime. Useful in quantum chromodynamics studies.
A situation in which a person is presented with a choice, any outcome of which causes something bad to happen. Sometimes known as Sophie's Choice.
The Navy's top secret "Perfect Concussion", a project exploring the use of sub-aural frequency blasts to erase memory. Part of the MKULTRA project set.

The staff carried by Hermes and Iris, the messenger of Hera. <!-- zerqvmmvfbyrmrewdfrr --> It is a short staff entwined by two serpents, sometimes surmounted by wings. Often confused with the the rod of Asclepius.

A device which allows one to decode or encode using a simple substitution cipher. Often used as promotional items, toys or decorative items.
vaovsevse
nsposetra
iggceighe
A prescriptive version of the English language that excludes all forms of the verb to be.
To strike (of lightning), to devastate; to cause to be thunderstruck. Foudroyer du regard. (see also Foudroyant).
Also called complete metamorphism, used to describe development that includes four life stages.
A fast movement of an eye, head or other part of the body or of a device. It can also be a fast shift in frequency of an emitted signal or other quick change.
A symmetrical stream cipher that uses the exclusive-or function to generate ciphertext.
A method of bypassing normal authentication and securing access to a system.
A principle requiring that every element in a narrative be necessary and irreplaceable, and that everything else be removed."Remove everything that has no relevance to the story".
DEFense readiness CONdition is an alert state used by the United States Armed Forces. It prescribes fivelevels of readiness from DEFCON 5 (least severe) to DEFCON 1 (most severe).
A preemptive surprise attack employing overwhelming force.

Describes circumstances whereby a moral agent is assigned moral blame or praise for an action or its consequences even though it is clear that said agent did not have full control over either the action or its consequences. Occurs whenever luck makes a moral difference.

Refers to an arsenal with three different branches of capability. The purpose of having three branches is to significantly reduce the possibility that an enemy could destroy all of a nation's forces in a first-strike attack.

A control mechanism designed to achieve a high level of security for especially critical material or operations. Under this rule all access and actions requires the presence of two authorized people at all times.
The name of a United States government long-term project to develop cryptography standards for public and government use.

Studies the behavior of c0mpr0m153d dynamical systems that are highly sensitive to initial conditions, a paradigm popularly referred to as the butterfly effect. Chaotic systems exhibit sensitive dependence, are deterministic and nonlinear.
Compassion;  part of the spiritual path.

Described as a sleeping, dormant potential force in the human organism; a form of corporeal energy. Some use "Kundalini syndrome" to refer to physical or psychological problems arising from experiences traditionally associated with Kundalini awakening.
To do something with passion and creativity; to leave something of yourself in your work.
A computer program which takes no input and produces a copy of its own source code as its only output.
Acting in place of another; having delegated authority.
Refers to something happening in the evening or at nightfall. Also refers to the rising or setting of a star at the same time as the sun sets.
Cause. Often used to explain the reason for something, particularly how an object or custom came into existence.

A series of experiments that produced the first potential confirmation of exotic hadrons, a four quark particle not classified by traditional quark models. Exotic Hadrons were recently confirmed by LHC experiments (particle Z(4430) ).
A corpeal entity that rises from the grave to complete some incomplete piece of work. May be violent or nonviolent. Similar in certain aspects to the Wiederg�nger.

The smallest scale of virtual particles that inhabit the universe appearing and disappearing. Imagine a swimming pool full of boiling water. Up close, you can see frothing and bubbles bursting, but if you viewed a satellite photo of the pool, the surface would appear unbroken.
A decision-making strategy that entails searching through the available alternatives until an acceptability threshold is met.
A turnabout,a reversal of opinion or policy.
Creatures whose song can wake the dead and lull the living to sleep.
Deathlessness. Is not a scholiastic athanasy better than none? - Lowell
Fear of being forgotten.

Occurs when rapid environmental change triggers organisms to make maladaptive behavioral decisions. Within evolutionary biology refers to an adaptive trait at has suddenly become maladaptive leading to the extinction of the species.
Military slang used to indicate a change in location. To leave, go.
Beginning to exist or appear; in an initial stage.
a cryptographic key exchange process in which a key is held in escrow, or stored, by a third party.
Mathematical notation representing the eighth power of a number.

an electromechanical device used by British cryptologists to help decipher German Enigma machine encrypted secret messages during World War II. Initial design was produced in 1939 by Alan Turing and refined by Gordon Welchman.
Subterranean; of or relating to the underworld.

A chipset developed and promoted by the US Government. Intended for implementation in voice equipment, such as crypto phones, and required users to give their cryptographic keys in escrow to the government.
A cryptosystem should be secure even if everything about the system, except the key, is public knowledge. Sometimes called Shannon's Maxim: "the enemy knows the system"

The German Kriegsmarine (Navy) used a variety of codebooks in combination with their M4 Enigma machine. The codebooks of the U-Boot department were printed with red water-solvable ink; when left behind in a sinking U-Boot, the codebooks would wipe themselves automatically.

A contraction of radar and dome, it is a structural, weatherproof enclosure that protects a microwave antenna. The material that minimally attenuates the em signal transmitted or received by the antenna. The Menwith Hill electronic surveillance base has many radome structures.

An NSA codename referring to spying on information systems through leaking emanations, including unintentional radio or electrical signals, sounds, and vibrations.
The TEMPEST standards mandate elements such as equipment distance from walls, amount of shielding, distance separating wires carrying classified vs. unclassified materials, and more.
A word that depending on context, can have opposite or contradictory meanings. Example - Bolt: To secure, or to flee. Anabasis - military advance, military retreat.

1)Represents The Ultimate Oneness. From this Ekam all objects of the universe formed. 2)Ekam ("make" backwards) is a build system which automatically figures out what to build and how to build it purely based on the source code; it needs no rule files.

a means by which memory traces are stored as biophysical or biochemical changes in the brain (and other neural tissue) in response to external stimuli. In Dianetics it is defined as a mental image picture which is a recording of an experience containing pain, unconsciousness and a real or fancied threat to survival.
Distinguished; eminent; excellent.
A published declaration of the intentions, motives, or views of the issuer, be it an individual, group, political party or government.
An image of parts of a human or animal body in rock often functioning as an important form of symbolism, used in ceremonies.
Coined by Marshall McLuhan meaning that the form of a medium embeds itself in the message, creating a symbiotic relationship by which the medium influences how the message is perceived.
Not jovial, mirthless; one who does not laugh.
Obligatory, compulsory; one's bounden duty.
Bad choice of words or poor pronunciation.
Duplicate or repeat (word or statement), often for emphasis.
A substance governing the pattern of tissue development in the process of morphogenes. See "The Chemical Basis of Morphogenesis" for more information.
Comes from the Sanskrit word for body. Relics used to emanate blessings and grace within the mindstream and experience of those connected to them. Sarira are also believed to ward off evil.

The most complex of the universe's extant systems at any time use progressively less space, time, energy and matter (STEM) to create the next level of complexity in their evolutionary development. Often linked to the concept of accelerating change. Related to ephemeralization.
Honest, truthful, accurate.
Of doubtful authorship or authenticity.
Brain Emotional Learning Based Intelligent Controller, a neurocontroller that mimics those parts of the brain which are known to produce emotion.

One of the first devices capable of adapting itself to the environment; it exhibited behaviours such as habituation, reinforcement and learning through its ability to maintain homeostasis in a changing environment.
Something that is inherently too great, complex, or abstract to be adequately communicated.
A word, form, case, or mood expressing an order or command.

An agent or substitute authorized to act for another person. Often used in context with other concepts: example Proxy war, a war where two powers use third parties as a substitute for fighting each other directly.
Resisting physical pressure; resisting constraint or compulsion.
The transformation of goods and services, as well as ideas or other entities that normally may not be considered goods into a commodity.
Between us, in confidence.
A loyal follower, especially one who executes orders without question, protest, or pity.
A field of computer science, artificial intelligence, and linguistics concerned with the interactions between computers and human (natural) languages.
Very strange, unusual, or shocking.

TET proposes three ethics that are the foundation or motivation for all ethics: security (or safety), engagement, and imagination. Attempts to highlight the importance of considering the development, purpose and function of biological systems or environments when considering morality and moral functioning.

a statement that is devoid of content because it asserts that all members of the empty set have a certain property. 
For example, the statement "all cell phones in the room are turned off" may be true simply because there are 
no cell phones  in the room. Such statements make assertions about objects which do not actually exist.
The time after sunset but before dark.
Denotes the discrete qualities, properties or characteristics of a thing which make it a particular thing. Haecceity is used to explain individuality.
Act of repeating a process with the aim of approaching a desired result. The results of one iteration are used as the starting point for the next iteration.
Skilled in many types of work; a jack-of-all-trades.

An ancient form of divination performed by choosing through some method a specific passage or poem from which to ascertain information. A related method is sortes, which involves opening a book and choosing some verse at first sight.
Move or traverse rapidly.

Radio communications system where all communication goes through a control or star. The control uses a call-sign to to communicate with an outstation for sending messages back and forth. 
The Star System, also known as the "Stern" was part of the Bletchley Park activity.
Figure of speech in the form of hyperbole taken to such extreme lengths insinuating a complete impossibility. Example: When pigs fly.
The principle or practice of concern for the welfare of others.
The starting of a self-sustaining process that is supposed to proceed without external input. Also used in statistics.
In which a person holds a delusion that a friend, spouse, parent, or other close family member has been replaced by an identical looking impostor.
An informal convention where one declares a first claim to something. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dibs for additional equivalents.
Lacking foresight; careless; thoughtless; neglecting to provide for future needs.<!-- 2urm2kyulyigebl5s2i -->
An individual who possesses outstanding technical ability in a particular art or field.
Concerns the nature of the universe and the meaning of life. Ernst Haeckel described it as:"the fundamental question of substance, the general question of the connection between matter and energy".
The point where a hero in battle has his finest moments.
Digressing from or unconnected with the main subject.

Describes a Kabbalistic concept of reincarnation. In Hebrew, the word gilgul means cycle and neshamot is plural for souls. Souls cycle through incarnations, attached to different human bodies over time.
Using few words when speaking.
The electric charge that accumulates in certain solid materials, such as crystals, bone and DNA in response to applied mechanical stress.
Former, at one time.
An impermanent stay reached by journey, or a period of temporary residence.
A structure constructed on land, that serves as an aid to navigation. Similar in concept to a lighthouse, a daymark though does not have a light and is usually only visible during daylight hours.
To deprive of force or strength; destroy the vigor of; weaken.
A system of organization where the elements of the organization are unranked (non-hierarchical) or where they possess the potential to be ranked a number of different ways.
An understatement in which an affirmative is expressed by negating its opposite. "The terms of the contract are not disagreeable to me".
The philosophical view that a variety of existing things can be explained in terms of a single reality or substance.
Travel from one place to another, especially a longer, meandering journey made on foot.
A venture or excursion usually off the beaten track.
